{{COI|date=April 2011}}<noinclude>
</noinclude> {{Infobox company | name = ESET, spol. s r.o. | logo = [[Image:ESET logo.svg|100px|ESET logo]] | type = Private Limited Company | foundation = Slovakia (1992) | location = Bratislava, Slovakia | key_people = Andrew Lee, Pavol Luka, Juraj Malcho, Richard Marko, Milan Masaryk, Ignacio Sbampato (alphabetical) | industry = Security software | key_products = ESET NOD32 Antivirus, ESET Smart Security | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = | slogan = "Think Smart" , (formerly ''"We protect your digital worlds"'') | homepage = [http://www.eset.com/ ESET.com] }}
'''ESET''' is an IT security company head-quartered in [[Bratislava]], [[Slovakia]] that was founded in 1992 by the merger of two private companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/me/about/profile/history/|title=About ESET: Company Profile: History|publisher=[[ESET]]|language=English|accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> The company was awarded as the most successful Slovak company in 2008, 2009 and 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ekonomika.sme.sk/c/5103938/firma-roka-je-eset-a-najuspesnejsia-banka-vub.html|title=Firma roka je Eset a najÃºspeÅ¡nejÅ¡ia banka VÃB|date=2009-11-10|publisher=[[SME (newspaper)|SME]]|language=Slovak|accessdate=28 April 2010}} ''"Eset je len treÅ¥ou spoloÄnosÅ¥ou, ktorÃ¡ dokÃ¡zala titul Firma roka obhÃ¡jiÅ¥."''</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://hn.hnonline.sk/2-39030630-k10000_detail-88|title=Eset je opÃ¤Å¥ firmou roka|last=Doktor|first=Vladislav|date=2009-11-11|publisher=[[HospodÃ¡rske noviny]]|language=Slovak|accessdate=28 April 2010}} ''"Firmou roka v dvanÃ¡stom roÄnÃ­ku udeÄ¾ovania cien za mimoriadne podnikateÄ¾skÃ© vÃ½sledky tÃ½Å¾dennÃ­ka Trend sa vÄera stala softvÃ©rovÃ¡ spoloÄnosÅ¥ Eset, ktorÃ¡ obhÃ¡jila vlaÅajÅ¡Ã­ primÃ¡t."''</ref> ESET is privately held and has branch offices in [[San Diego]], [[California]]; [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]]; [[Prague]], [[Czech Republic]], [[KrakÃ³w]], [[Poland]] and [[Singapore]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com.sg/html/86/1017/|title=ESET opens Asia-Pacific headquarters in Singapore|date=27 August 2010|publisher=Version-2 Limited|language=English|accessdate=20 August 2011}}</ref> as well as distributors in over 180 countries.
In December 2010, the company announced the appointment of Richard Marko as Global CEO, Milan Masaryk as CFO, Pavol Luka as CTO, Juraj Malcho as Chief Research Officer, Ignacio Sbampato as director of global sales and marketing, and Andrew Lee as the CEO of its North American branch. ESET's founders remain on as the company's board.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.sk/o-nas/press-centrum/tlacove-spravy/article/novym-generalnym-riaditelom-spolocnosti-eset-bude-richard-marko/|title=NovÃ½m generÃ¡lnym riaditeÄ¾om spoloÄnosti ESET bude Richard Marko|date=2010-12-29|publisher=[[ESET]]|language=Slovak|accessdate=24 January 2011}}</ref>
== Products == {{Main|ESET NOD32}}
ESET's first product was NOD, an [[antivirus software]] for computers running [[MS-DOS]]. In 1998, ESET introduced NOD32 1.0 for [[Microsoft Windows]], with version 2.0 following in 2003. The last supported build of the 2.x codebase is 2.70.39, released in November 2006 to add support for Microsoft [[Windows Vista]]. In January 2010, ESET announced they would cease selling or providing downloads of NOD32 2.x in February 2010 and no longer provide signature updates or support after February 2012.<ref>http://www.eset.com/company/article/ESET-to-discontinue-NOD32-Antivirus-2.7/6974.php?contentID=6974 ESET to discontinue NOD32 Antivirus 2.7]</ref>
In November 2007, ESET released v3.0 of ESET NOD32 Antivirus and ESET Smart Security v3.0, the latter being a new product combining ESET NOD32 Antivirus with [[antispam]] and [[Firewall (computing)|firewall]] functions. In March 2009, ESET released v4.0 of ESET NOD32 Antivirus and ESET Smart Security. In March 2010, ESET released v4.2 of ESET NOD32 Antivirus and ESET Smart Security.<ref>[http://www.eset.com/press-center/article/eset-releases-service-build-42-for-eset-smart-security-and-eset-nod32-antivirus/7177 ESET Releases Service Build 4.2 for ESET Smart Security and ESET NOD32 Antivirus]</ref><ref>[http://www.eset.eu/press-ESET-launches-ESET-Mail-Security-for-Microsoft-Exchange-Server-and-ESET-Smart-Security-4_2 ESET launches ESET Mail Security for Microsoft Exchange Server and ESET Smart Security 4.2]</ref>
In September 2010, ESET released ESET NOD32 Antivirus for Mac OS X Business Edition<ref>[http://www.eset.com/support/news/7798 ESET NOD32 Antivirus 4 Business Edition for Mac OS X released]</ref> and in November 2010, a home version called ESET Cybersecurity for Mac OS X.<ref>[http://www.eset.com/support/news/7971 ESET Cybersecurity for Mac v4.0.58 has been released]</ref>
ESET NOD32 Antivirus and ESET Smart Security 4.2 both support Windows 2000, XP, Server 2003, Server 2003 R2, Vista, Server 2008, Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7; additionally, ESET NOD32 Antivirus 4.2 supports Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 with Service Pack 6a.<ref>[http://www.eset.eu/products/nod32-for-windows-4-system-requirements ESET NOD32 Antivirus 4.2 - System Requirements]</ref> Support for 64-bit ([[x86-64]], not [[IA-64]]) versions of these operating systems is provided, although the program runs both 32-bit and 64-bit processes.<ref>[http://training.eset.com/kb/index.php?option=com_kb&Itemid=29&page=articles&articleid=401 ESET Knowledgebase Article #401, Is ESET NOD32 Antivirus a native 64-bit application?]</ref> Users of older versions of Microsoft Windows, such as Windows 95, 98, Me and NT 4.0, will need to install the older 2.70.39 release. In addition to Microsoft Windows the company also supports the following operating systems: [[Berkeley Software Distribution|BSD]], [[Linux]], [[Mac OS X]], [[Novell NetWare]] and [[Sun Solaris]].
In May 2011, ESET began publicly beta testing ESET NOD32 Antivirus and ESET Smart Security version 5 which has now been released as a free upgrade to all current ESET NOD32 & Smart Business 4.x license holders as well a free trial for first time clients. Improvements in ESET NOD32 and Smart Security 5 includes an Enhanced Media Control that automaticlly scans all USB, external and CD/DVD drives for any threats and blocks removable media based on type and manufacturer of the media. Users can customize the behavior of the software by specifying rules for current running processes, programs, registry and tweek the security posture of the software. Gamer Mode being introduced into the software conserves system resources and activities for gaming and other full screen programs by haulting all pop-up windows that require user intervention. The new ESET Live Grid is a new cloud powered real-time protection scanner that protects against online based internet threats and online social-media exploits. Parents now have control over the computer with ESET Parental Control feature that blocks potentially offensive and dangerous web content by specifying rules and selecting various pre-defined categories.<ref>[http://www.eset.com/home/products/smart-security/?productdd=1]</ref>
ESET also has ESET Mobile Security for [[Windows Mobile]] users, [[Symbian OS]] and [[Android (operating_system)|Android]]. In addition to malware protection it provides antispam filtering for [[SMS]] messages, a [[firewall (computing)|firewall]] and anti-theft features, like SIM locking and remote wipe.<ref>[http://www.eset.com/home/mobile-antivirus ESET Mobile Security]</ref>
== Technology == ESET's use of [[assembly language]] in its products contributes to their low system requirements and disk space utilization.<ref>[http://eset.com.au/compare/intro_nod32.html Assembly language usage in NOD32]</ref><ref>[http://training.eset.com/kb/index.php?option=com_kb&Itemid=29&page=articles&articleid=358 ESET Knowledgebase Article #358, ESET NOD32 Antivirus System Requirements]</ref>
ESET calls its scanning engine ThreatSense, and makes extensive use of generic signatures and heuristics.<ref>[http://www.eset.com/products/threatsense.php Zero-Day Attack - Heuristics and Signatures software from ESET]</ref> This should not be confused with ThreatSense.Net, which is ESET's system for submitting suspicious files and [[malware]] to their virus researchers.<ref>[http://www.eset.eu/threat-center/threat-sense.net ThreatSense.Net Global malware monitoring system]</ref>
ESET's products are regularly tested by organizations such as AV-Comparatives, AV-Test and [[Virus Bulletin]]. ESET is the first company to receive sixty-five (65) VB100 awards from Virus Bulletin and has not missed a single threat in Virus Bulletin's tests in the past six years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.virusbtn.com/vb100/archive/results?vendor=VE14|title=Virus Bulletin VB100 Results Overview: ESET|publisher=[[Virus Bulletin]]|language=English|accessdate=12 January 2011}}</ref> ESET's products are regularly certified by [[ICSA Labs]] and [[West Coast Labs]].
